bug.author: LeonardAukea
bug.summary: Provided notebook name needs parsing to follow accepted kubernetes naming convention for resources like mounted volumes
bug.description:
/kind bug I installed kubeflow on my local kubernetes cluster following the instructions for kfctl_k8s_istio. This worked fine and dandy. I happened to notice that there where some restrictions for what may be provided as a name for the notebook, if a server was to launch sucessfully. I guess this is due to the mounted volume name being inherited from the name given to the notebook. It would make sense to make sure all names provided to rescources follow the following rules:
By convention, the names of Kubernetes resources should be up to maximum length of 253 characters and consist of lower case alphanumeric characters, -, and ., but certain resources have more specific restrictions. https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/
I tried to find the location in the codebase to add functionality for parsing the notebook name in order to force the above conventions when allocated to some kubernetes resource (volume, container, ..) but I'm not yet very familiar with the codebase. I guess that it has something to do with the templated var notebook-name. One could pipe lower and remove special chars and replace whitespaces and underscores with -. (Assuming jinja2) Environment:
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard): kfctl version: kfctl v0.6.2-rc.2 Kubernetes platform: docker-for-desktop Kubernetes version: (use kubectl version): Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"14", GitVersion:"v1.14.3", GitCommit:"5e53fd6bc17c0dec8434817e69b04a25d8ae0ff0", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-06-07T09:55:27Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.5", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"darwin/amd64"} Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"14", GitVersion:"v1.14.3", GitCommit:"5e53fd6bc17c0dec8434817e69b04a25d8ae0ff0", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-06-06T01:36:19Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.5", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"} OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): macOS 10.15 (19A536g)
